definition: shiver all over though not cold/tremble with fear/shudder
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

sentences.english: One 1970 stop still gives him chills.
The very thought of it make one shudder.
sentences.chinese: 只要一想到此，就會令人不寒而慄。

sentences.english: It was spine-chilling to learn that a murderer was in our neighborhood.
sentences.chinese: 獲悉殺人兇手就在我們附近，讓人不寒而慄。

sentences.english: The sight made my blood curdle.
Do you wince at the thought of swallowing a tequila worm?
sentences.chinese: 吞嚥一杯蟲子蒸餾酒，這想法有沒有讓你不寒而慄？

sentences.english: She shivered at the thought of going into the dark house alone.
sentences.chinese: 她想到要獨自走進那所黑洞洞的房子裏去就不寒而慄。

sentences.english: My scalp began to prickle as I realized the horrible truth.
sentences.chinese: 我瞭解到了那令人恐怖的事實時，頓時感到不寒而慄。

sentences.english: Even thinking of it makes me shake.
sentences.chinese: 就連想到牙醫我都不寒而慄。

sentences.english: He shivered with fear when she slewed her head round.
sentences.chinese: 等她猛地轉過頭時，他不寒而慄。

sentences.english: He long with five hands, stained with bloodshot eyes, makes chilling reading.
sentences.chinese: 他長着五隻手，滿身都是血絲，讓人看了不寒而慄。

sentences.english: I can't talk about that experience.The mere thought strikes terror into me!
sentences.chinese: 我不敢提起我的那次經歷，一想起它我都不寒而慄。

sentences.english: I recognized my own handwriting and felt a chill.
sentences.chinese: 當發現那是我自己的筆跡時我不寒而慄。

sentences.english: She shuddered to think of her bitter past.
sentences.chinese: 她想起了辛酸的過去真是不寒而慄。

sentences.english: There are share of chilling, the kind of cold sweat, the cold feeling of Si-Si-chen.
sentences.chinese: 還有那份不寒而慄，那種冷汗涔涔的冰涼感覺。

sentences.english: She shuddered to think of those days.
sentences.chinese: 想到那些歲月她不寒而慄。

sentences.english: The photos are chilling and hauntingly beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 照片既令人不寒而慄，又透着一種縈繞於心的美。

definition: to click one's tongue in wonder (idiom)/to be astonished
lit. shocks the eye, astonishes the heart (idiom); shocking/horrible to see/a ghastly sight
lingering fear/fear after the event/post-traumatic stress
lit. heart alarmed, body leaping (idiom); fear and trepidation in the face of disaster
to feel deep veneration for sb (idiom)
shaking one to the core/extremely disturbing/hair-raising (idiom)
